GIBAS Minta Maaf soal Ormas 'Paksa' Minimarket Kelola Parkir
04 Nov 2019, 20:20 by Isal Mawardi
Bekasi - Pihak ormas Gabungan Inisiatif Barisan Anak Siliwangi (GIBAS) angkat bicara soal video 'pemaksaan' dalam pengelolaan parkir minimarket di Kota Bekasi. Pihak GIBAS meminta maaf atas kejadian viral itu.
"Mohon maaf atas statement yang kemarin kita sampaikan pada saat demo. Intinya, saya dan kawan-kawan tidak bermaksud apa-apa terhadap statement tersebut. Intinya, kami hanya ingin mendukung pemerintah dan bersinergi dengan Pemkot Bekasi mengenai pemberdayaan parkir di Kota Bekasi, kami juga selalu bersinergi dengan Polresta Kota Bekasi dan Kodim Kota Bekasi," ujar Ketua GIBAS Kota Bekasi, Deni Muhammad Ali, di Polres Metro Bekasi, Jalan Pramuka, Bekasi Selatan, Kota Bekasi, Senin (4/11/2019).
Deni menyebut statement-nya dalam video yang ia lontarkan terkait pemaksaan kerja sama ormas dan minimarket di Kota Bekasi merupakan kekhilafan.
"Sekali lagi saya mohon maaf atas kekhilafan statement yang terjadi kemarin, mudah-mudahan ini menjadi awal baik bagi kita semua, biar kita lebih bersinergi lagi antara pengusaha, pemerintah kota, Polresta Kota Bekasi, Kodim Kota Bekasi dan warga Kota Bekasi," ujar Deni.
Ia menegaskan tidak ada kerja sama antara ormas dan Bappenda Kota Bekasi terkait penarikan parkir tersebut. Tapi Deni mengakui Bappenda Kota Bekasi mengeluarkan surat tugas kepada ormas GIBAS terkait pengelolaan parkir di minimarket.
"Kalau tugas kerja sama itu tidak ada, jadi sifatnya surat tugas parkir. Jadi tidak ada kerjasama ya, jadi mekanismenya, Bappenda mengeluarkan surat tugas parkir. Nah kebenaran kita warga Kota Bekasi yang memang notabene, kita tidak mau menjadi jukir ya, akhirnya kita berdayakanlah kawan-kawan kita yang nganggur di Kota Bekasi, ya memang sumber daya manusianya kurang, yang bisa parkir kita berdayakan mereka," ujar Deni.

GIBAS Apologizes about Minimarkets 'Forced' Community Organizations to Manage Parking
04 Nov 2019, 20:20 by Isal Mawardi
Bekasi - The mass organization of the Siliwangi Children Barisan Initiative (GIBAS) spoke out about the 'coercion' video in managing minimarkets parking in Bekasi City. GIBAS apologized for the viral incident.
"Sorry for the statement we made yesterday at the demonstration. The point is, my friends and I don't mean anything about the statement. Basically, we only want to support the government and work together with the Bekasi City Government regarding the empowerment of parking in Bekasi City, we also always synergize with the Bekasi City Police and the Bekasi City Military District Command, "said Bekasi City GIBAS Chairperson, Deni Muhammad Ali, at the Bekasi Metro Police Station, Jalan Pramuka, South Bekasi, Bekasi City, Monday (4/11/2019).
Deni said his statement in the video he made related to the coercion of mass organizations and minimarkets in Bekasi City was a mistake.
"Once again I apologize for the negligence of the statement that occurred yesterday, hopefully this will be a good start for us all, so that we are more synergized between businessmen, city government, Bekasi City Police, Bekasi City Kodim and Bekasi City residents," said Deni .
He asserted that there was no collaboration between the mass organizations and the City of Bekasi's Bappenda related to the parking recall. But Deni admitted that Bekasi City Bappenda issued a letter of assignment to GIBAS organizations related to parking management in minimarkets.
"If the cooperation task does not exist, so the nature of the parking assignment letter. So there is no cooperation, yes, so the mechanism, Bappenda issued a parking assignment letter. Well the truth is we are Bekasi City residents who are incidentally, we do not want to be carved huh, finally we empower "Our friends who are unemployed in Bekasi City, indeed their human resources are lacking, they can park them to empower them," said Deni.
